24/* If the number of output characters is larger than INT_MAX, the
25 ISO C99 standard is silent, but POSIX says concerning the snprintf()
26 function:
27 "[EOVERFLOW] The value of n is greater than {INT_MAX} or the
28 number of bytes needed to hold the output excluding the
29 terminating null is greater than {INT_MAX}." See:
30 http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/functions/fprintf.html
31 But it doesn't say anything concerning the other printf-like functions.
32 A defect report has been submitted to austin-review-l (item 2532).
33 So, for the time being, we return a negative value and set the erange
34 flag, and set errno to EOVERFLOW in POSIX system. */
35
36/* Note: Due to limitations from the C standard and GMP, if
37 size_t < unsigned int (which is allowed by the C standard but unlikely
38 to occur on any platform), the behavior is undefined for output that
39 would reach SIZE_MAX = (size_t) -1 (if the result cannot be delivered,
40 there should be an assertion failure, but this could not be tested). */
41
42#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
43# include "config.h"
44#endif
45
46/* The mpfr_printf-like functions are defined only if <stdarg.h> exists.
47 Since they use mpf_t, they cannot be defined with mini-gmp. */
48#if defined(HAVE_STDARG) && !defined(MPFR_USE_MINI_GMP)
49
50#include <stdarg.h>
51
52#ifndef HAVE_VA_COPY
53# ifdef HAVE___VA_COPY
54# define va_copy(dst,src) __va_copy(dst, src)
55# else
56/* autoconf manual advocates this fallback.
57 This is also the solution chosen by gmp */
58# define va_copy(dst,src) \
59 do { memcpy(&(dst), &(src), sizeof(va_list)); } while (0)
60# endif /* HAVE___VA_COPY */
61#endif /* HAVE_VA_COPY */
62
63#ifdef HAVE_WCHAR_H
64#include <wchar.h>
65#endif
66
67#if defined (__cplusplus)
68#include <cstddef>
69#else
70#include <stddef.h> /* for ptrdiff_t */
71#endif
72
73#include <errno.h>

75#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
76#include "mpfr-intmax.h"
77#include "mpfr-impl.h"

79/* Define a length modifier corresponding to mpfr_prec_t.
80 We use literal string instead of literal character so as to permit future
81 extension to long long int ("ll"). */
82#if _MPFR_PREC_FORMAT == 1
83#define MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_TYPE "h"
84#define MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_SIZE 1
85#elif _MPFR_PREC_FORMAT == 2
86#define MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_TYPE ""
87#define MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_SIZE 0
88#elif _MPFR_PREC_FORMAT == 3
89#define MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_TYPE "l"
90#define MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_SIZE 1
91#else
92#error "mpfr_prec_t size not supported"
93#endif
94
95/* Output for special values defined in the C99 standard */
96#define MPFR_NAN_STRING_LC "nan"
97#define MPFR_NAN_STRING_UC "NAN"
98#define MPFR_NAN_STRING_LENGTH 3
99#define MPFR_INF_STRING_LC "inf"
100#define MPFR_INF_STRING_UC "INF"
101#define MPFR_INF_STRING_LENGTH 3
102
103/* The implicit \0 is useless, but we do not write num_to_text[16]
104 otherwise g++ complains. */
105static const char num_to_text[] = "0123456789abcdef";
106
107/* some macro and functions for parsing format string */
108
109/* Read an integer; saturate to INT_MAX. */
110#define READ_INT(ap, format, specinfo, field, label_out) \
111 do { \
112 while (*(format)) \
113 { \
114 int _i; \
115 switch (*(format)) \
116 { \
117 case '0': \
118 case '1': \
119 case '2': \
120 case '3': \
121 case '4': \
122 case '5': \
123 case '6': \
124 case '7': \
125 case '8': \
126 case '9': \
127 specinfo.field = (specinfo.field <= INT_MAX / 10) ? \
128 specinfo.field * 10 : INT_MAX; \
129 _i = *(format) - '0'; \
130 MPFR_ASSERTN (_i >= 0 && _i <= 9); \
131 specinfo.field = (specinfo.field <= INT_MAX - _i) ? \
132 specinfo.field + _i : INT_MAX; \
133 ++(format); \
134 break; \
135 case '*': \
136 specinfo.field = va_arg ((ap), int); \
137 ++(format); \
138 default: \
139 goto label_out; \
140 } \
141 } \
142 } while (0)
143
144/* arg_t contains all the types described by the 'type' field of the
145 format string */
146enum arg_t
147 {
148 NONE,
149 CHAR_ARG,
150 SHORT_ARG,
151 LONG_ARG,
152 LONG_LONG_ARG,
153 INTMAX_ARG,
154 SIZE_ARG,
155 PTRDIFF_ARG,
156 LONG_DOUBLE_ARG,
157 MPF_ARG,
158 MPQ_ARG,
159 MP_LIMB_ARG,
160 MP_LIMB_ARRAY_ARG,
161 MPZ_ARG,
162 MPFR_PREC_ARG,
163 MPFR_ARG,
164 UNSUPPORTED
165 };
166
167/* Each conversion specification of the format string will be translated in a
168 printf_spec structure by the parser.
169 This structure is adapted from the GNU libc one. */
170struct printf_spec
171{
172 unsigned int alt:1; /* # flag */
173 unsigned int space:1; /* Space flag */
174 unsigned int left:1; /* - flag */
175 unsigned int showsign:1; /* + flag */
176 unsigned int group:1; /* ' flag */
177
178 int width; /* Width */
179 int prec; /* Precision */
180 size_t size; /* Wanted size (0 iff snprintf with size=0) */
181
182 enum arg_t arg_type; /* Type of argument */
183 mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode; /* Rounding mode */
184 char spec; /* Conversion specifier */
185
186 char pad; /* Padding character */
187};
188
189static void
190specinfo_init (struct printf_spec *specinfo)
191{
192 specinfo->alt = 0;
193 specinfo->space = 0;
194 specinfo->left = 0;
195 specinfo->showsign = 0;
196 specinfo->group = 0;
197 specinfo->width = 0;
198 specinfo->prec = 0;
199 specinfo->size = 1;
200 specinfo->arg_type = NONE;
201 specinfo->rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDN;
202 specinfo->spec = '\0';
203 specinfo->pad = ' ';
204}
205
206#define FLOATING_POINT_ARG_TYPE(at) \
207 ((at) == MPFR_ARG || (at) == MPF_ARG || (at) == LONG_DOUBLE_ARG)
208
209#define INTEGER_LIKE_ARG_TYPE(at) \
210 ((at) == SHORT_ARG || (at) == LONG_ARG || (at) == LONG_LONG_ARG \
211 || (at) == INTMAX_ARG || (at) == MPFR_PREC_ARG || (at) == MPZ_ARG \
212 || (at) == MPQ_ARG || (at) == MP_LIMB_ARG || (at) == MP_LIMB_ARRAY_ARG \
213 || (at) == CHAR_ARG || (at) == SIZE_ARG || (at) == PTRDIFF_ARG)
214
215static int
216specinfo_is_valid (struct printf_spec spec)
217{
218 switch (spec.spec)
219 {
220 case 'n':
221 return -1;
222
223 case 'a': case 'A':
224 case 'e': case 'E':
225 case 'f': case 'F':
226 case 'g': case 'G':
227 return (spec.arg_type == NONE
228 || FLOATING_POINT_ARG_TYPE (spec.arg_type));
229
230 case 'b':
231 return spec.arg_type == MPFR_ARG;
232
233 case 'd': case 'i':
234 case 'u': case 'o':
235 case 'x': case 'X':
236 return (spec.arg_type == NONE
237 || INTEGER_LIKE_ARG_TYPE (spec.arg_type));
238
239 case 'c':
240 case 's':
241 return (spec.arg_type == NONE || spec.arg_type == LONG_ARG);
242
243 case 'p':
244 return spec.arg_type == NONE;
245
246 default:
247 return 0;
248 }
249}
250
251static const char *
252parse_flags (const char *format, struct printf_spec *specinfo)
253{
254 while (*format)
255 {
256 switch (*format)
257 {
258 case '0':
259 specinfo->pad = '0';
260 ++format;
261 break;
262 case '#':
263 specinfo->alt = 1;
264 ++format;
265 break;
266 case '+':
267 specinfo->showsign = 1;
268 ++format;
269 break;
270 case ' ':
271 specinfo->space = 1;
272 ++format;
273 break;
274 case '-':
275 specinfo->left = 1;
276 ++format;
277 break;
278 case '\'':
279 /* Single UNIX Specification for thousand separator */
280 specinfo->group = 1;
281 ++format;
282 break;
283 default:
284 return format;
285 }
286 }
287 return format;
288}
289
290static const char *
291parse_arg_type (const char *format, struct printf_spec *specinfo)
292{
293 switch (*format)
294 {
295 case '\0':
296 break;
297 case 'h':
298 if (*++format == 'h')
299 {
300 ++format;
301 specinfo->arg_type = CHAR_ARG;
302 }
303 else
304 specinfo->arg_type = SHORT_ARG;
305 break;
306 case 'l':
307 if (*++format == 'l')
308 {
309 ++format;
310#if defined (HAVE_LONG_LONG)
311 specinfo->arg_type = LONG_LONG_ARG;
312#else
313 specinfo->arg_type = UNSUPPORTED;
314#endif
315 break;
316 }
317 else
318 {
319 specinfo->arg_type = LONG_ARG;
320 break;
321 }
322 case 'j':
323 ++format;
324#if defined(_MPFR_H_HAVE_INTMAX_T)
325 specinfo->arg_type = INTMAX_ARG;
326#else
327 specinfo->arg_type = UNSUPPORTED;
328#endif
329 break;
330 case 'z':
331 ++format;
332 specinfo->arg_type = SIZE_ARG;
333 break;
334 case 't':
335 ++format;
336 specinfo->arg_type = PTRDIFF_ARG;
337 break;
338 case 'L':
339 ++format;
340 specinfo->arg_type = LONG_DOUBLE_ARG;
341 break;
342 case 'F':
343 ++format;
344 specinfo->arg_type = MPF_ARG;
345 break;
346 case 'Q':
347 ++format;
348 specinfo->arg_type = MPQ_ARG;
349 break;
350 case 'M':
351 ++format;
352 /* The 'M' specifier was added in gmp 4.2.0 */
353 specinfo->arg_type = MP_LIMB_ARG;
354 break;
355 case 'N':
356 ++format;
357 specinfo->arg_type = MP_LIMB_ARRAY_ARG;
358 break;
359 case 'Z':
360 ++format;
361 specinfo->arg_type = MPZ_ARG;
362 break;
363
364 /* mpfr specific specifiers */
365 case 'P':
366 ++format;
367 specinfo->arg_type = MPFR_PREC_ARG;
368 break;
369 case 'R':
370 ++format;
371 specinfo->arg_type = MPFR_ARG;
372 }
373 return format;
374}
375
376
377/* some macros and functions filling the buffer */
378
379/* CONSUME_VA_ARG removes from va_list AP the type expected by SPECINFO */
380
381/* With a C++ compiler wchar_t and enumeration in va_list are converted to
382 integer type : int, unsigned int, long or unsigned long (unfortunately,
383 this is implementation dependent).
384 We follow gmp which assumes in print/doprnt.c that wchar_t is converted
385 to int (because wchar_t <= int).
386 For wint_t, we assume that the case WINT_MAX < INT_MAX yields an
387 integer promotion. */
388#ifdef HAVE_WCHAR_H
389#if defined(WINT_MAX) && WINT_MAX < INT_MAX
390typedef int mpfr_va_wint; /* integer promotion */
391#else
392typedef wint_t mpfr_va_wint;
393#endif
394#define CASE_LONG_ARG(specinfo, ap) \
395 case LONG_ARG: \
396 if ((specinfo).spec == 'd' || (specinfo).spec == 'i' \
397 || (specinfo).spec == 'o' || (specinfo).spec == 'u' \
398 || (specinfo).spec == 'x' || (specinfo).spec == 'X') \
399 (void) va_arg ((ap), long); \
400 else if ((specinfo).spec == 'c') \
401 (void) va_arg ((ap), mpfr_va_wint); \
402 else if ((specinfo).spec == 's') \
403 (void) va_arg ((ap), int); /* we assume integer promotion */ \
404 break;
405#else
406#define CASE_LONG_ARG(specinfo, ap) \
407 case LONG_ARG: \
408 (void) va_arg ((ap), long); \
409 break;
410#endif
411
412#if defined(_MPFR_H_HAVE_INTMAX_T)
413#define CASE_INTMAX_ARG(specinfo, ap) \
414 case INTMAX_ARG: \
415 (void) va_arg ((ap), intmax_t); \
416 break;
417#else
418#define CASE_INTMAX_ARG(specinfo, ap)
419#endif
420
421#ifdef HAVE_LONG_LONG
422#define CASE_LONG_LONG_ARG(specinfo, ap) \
423 case LONG_LONG_ARG: \
424 (void) va_arg ((ap), long long); \
425 break;
426#else
427#define CASE_LONG_LONG_ARG(specinfo, ap)
428#endif
429
430#define CONSUME_VA_ARG(specinfo, ap) \
431 do { \
432 switch ((specinfo).arg_type) \
433 { \
434 case CHAR_ARG: \
435 case SHORT_ARG: \
436 (void) va_arg ((ap), int); \
437 break; \
438 CASE_LONG_ARG (specinfo, ap) \
439 CASE_LONG_LONG_ARG (specinfo, ap) \
440 CASE_INTMAX_ARG (specinfo, ap) \
441 case SIZE_ARG: \
442 (void) va_arg ((ap), size_t); \
443 break; \
444 case PTRDIFF_ARG: \
445 (void) va_arg ((ap), ptrdiff_t); \
446 break; \
447 case LONG_DOUBLE_ARG: \
448 (void) va_arg ((ap), long double); \
449 break; \
450 case MPF_ARG: \
451 (void) va_arg ((ap), mpf_srcptr); \
452 break; \
453 case MPQ_ARG: \
454 (void) va_arg ((ap), mpq_srcptr); \
455 break; \
456 case MP_LIMB_ARG: \
457 (void) va_arg ((ap), mp_limb_t); \
458 break; \
459 case MP_LIMB_ARRAY_ARG: \
460 (void) va_arg ((ap), mpfr_limb_ptr); \
461 (void) va_arg ((ap), mp_size_t); \
462 break; \
463 case MPZ_ARG: \
464 (void) va_arg ((ap), mpz_srcptr); \
465 break; \
466 default: \
467 switch ((specinfo).spec) \
468 { \
469 case 'd': \
470 case 'i': \
471 case 'o': \
472 case 'u': \
473 case 'x': \
474 case 'X': \
475 case 'c': \
476 (void) va_arg ((ap), int); \
477 break; \
478 case 'f': \
479 case 'F': \
480 case 'e': \
481 case 'E': \
482 case 'g': \
483 case 'G': \
484 case 'a': \
485 case 'A': \
486 (void) va_arg ((ap), double); \
487 break; \
488 case 's': \
489 (void) va_arg ((ap), char *); \
490 break; \
491 case 'p': \
492 (void) va_arg ((ap), void *); \
493 } \
494 } \
495 } while (0)
496
497/* process the format part which does not deal with mpfr types,
498 jump to external label 'error' if gmp_asprintf return -1.
499 Note: start and end are pointers to the format string, so that
500 size_t is the best type to express the difference.
501 */
502#define FLUSH(flag, start, end, ap, buf_ptr) \
503 do { \
504 const size_t n = (end) - (start); \
505 if ((flag)) \
506 /* previous specifiers are understood by gmp_printf */ \
507 { \
508 MPFR_TMP_DECL (marker); \
509 char *fmt_copy, *s; \
510 int length; \
511 \
512 MPFR_TMP_MARK (marker); \
513 fmt_copy = (char*) MPFR_TMP_ALLOC (n + 1); \
514 strncpy (fmt_copy, (start), n); \
515 fmt_copy[n] = '\0'; \
516 length = gmp_vasprintf (&s, fmt_copy, (ap)); \
517 if (length < 0) \
518 { \
519 MPFR_TMP_FREE (marker); \
520 goto error; \
521 } \
522 buffer_cat ((buf_ptr), s, length); \
523 mpfr_free_str (s); \
524 (flag) = 0; \
525 MPFR_TMP_FREE (marker); \
526 } \
527 else if ((start) != (end)) \
528 /* no conversion specification, just simple characters */ \
529 buffer_cat ((buf_ptr), (start), n); \
530 } while (0)
531
532/* Note: in case some form of %n is used in the format string,
533 we may need the maximum signed integer type for len. */
534struct string_buffer
535{
536 char *start; /* beginning of the buffer */
537 char *curr; /* null terminating character */
538 size_t size; /* buffer capacity */
539 mpfr_intmax_t len; /* string length or -1 if overflow */
540};
541
542static void
543buffer_init (struct string_buffer *b, size_t s)
544{
545 if (s != 0)
546 {
547 b->start = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (s);
548 b->start[0] = '\0';
549 b->curr = b->start;
550 }
551 b->size = s;
552 b->len = 0;
553}
554
555/* Increase the len field of the buffer. Return non-zero iff overflow. */
556static int
557buffer_incr_len (struct string_buffer *b, size_t len)
558{
559 if (b->len == -1)
560 return 1;
561 else
562 {
563 /* We need to take mpfr_uintmax_t as the type must be as large
564 as both size_t (which is unsigned) and mpfr_intmax_t (which
565 is used for the 'n' format specifier). */
566 mpfr_uintmax_t newlen = (mpfr_uintmax_t) b->len + len;
567
568 /* mpfr_uintmax_t is unsigned, thus the above is valid, but one
569 has newlen < len in case of overflow. */
570
571 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (newlen < len || newlen > MPFR_INTMAX_MAX))
572 {
573 b->len = -1;
574 return 1;
575 }
576 else
577 {
578 b->len = newlen;
579 return 0;
580 }
581 }
582}
583
584/* Increase buffer size by a number of character being the least multiple of
585 4096 greater than LEN+1. */
586static void
587buffer_widen (struct string_buffer *b, size_t len)
588{
589 const size_t pos = b->curr - b->start;
590 const size_t n = 0x1000 + (len & ~((size_t) 0xfff));
591
592 /* There are currently limitations here. We would need to switch to
593 the null-size behavior once there is an overflow in the buffer. */
594
595 MPFR_ASSERTN (n >= 0x1000 && n >= len);
596
597 MPFR_ASSERTD (*b->curr == '\0');
598 MPFR_ASSERTD (pos < b->size);
599
600 MPFR_ASSERTN (b->size < ((size_t) -1) - n);
601
602 b->start =
603 (char *) mpfr_reallocate_func (b->start, b->size, b->size + n);
604 b->size += n;
605 b->curr = b->start + pos;
606
607 MPFR_ASSERTD (pos < b->size);
608 MPFR_ASSERTD (*b->curr == '\0');
609}
610
611/* Concatenate the LEN first characters of the string S to the buffer B and
612 expand it if needed. Return non-zero if overflow. */
613static int
614buffer_cat (struct string_buffer *b, const char *s, size_t len)
615{
616 MPFR_ASSERTD (len > 0);
617 MPFR_ASSERTD (len <= strlen (s));
618
619 if (buffer_incr_len (b, len))
620 return 1;
621
622 if (b->size != 0)
623 {
624 MPFR_ASSERTD (*b->curr == '\0');
625 MPFR_ASSERTN (b->size < ((size_t) -1) - len);
626 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (b->curr + len >= b->start + b->size))
627 buffer_widen (b, len);
628
629 /* strncat is similar to strncpy here, except that strncat ensures
630 that the buffer will be null-terminated. */
631 strncat (b->curr, s, len);
632 b->curr += len;
633
634 MPFR_ASSERTD (b->curr < b->start + b->size);
635 MPFR_ASSERTD (*b->curr == '\0');
636 }
637
638 return 0;
639}
640
641/* Add N characters C to the end of buffer B. Return non-zero if overflow. */
642static int
643buffer_pad (struct string_buffer *b, const char c, const size_t n)
644{
645 MPFR_ASSERTD (n > 0);
646
647 if (buffer_incr_len (b, n))
648 return 1;
649
650 if (b->size != 0)
651 {
652 MPFR_ASSERTD (*b->curr == '\0');
653 MPFR_ASSERTN (b->size < ((size_t) -1) - n);
654 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (b->curr + n >= b->start + b->size))
655 buffer_widen (b, n);
656
657 if (n == 1)
658 *b->curr = c;
659 else
660 memset (b->curr, c, n);
661 b->curr += n;
662 *b->curr = '\0';
663
664 MPFR_ASSERTD (b->curr < b->start + b->size);
665 }
666
667 return 0;
668}
669
670/* Form a string by concatenating the first LEN characters of STR to TZ
671 zero(s), insert into one character C each 3 characters starting from end
672 to beginning and concatenate the result to the buffer B. */
673static int
674buffer_sandwich (struct string_buffer *b, char *str, size_t len,
675 const size_t tz, const char c)
676{
677 MPFR_ASSERTD (len <= strlen (str));
678
679 if (c == '\0')
680 return
681 buffer_cat (b, str, len) ||
682 buffer_pad (b, '0', tz);
683 else
684 {
685 const size_t step = 3;
686 const size_t size = len + tz;
687 const size_t r = size % step == 0 ? step : size % step;
688 const size_t q = size % step == 0 ? size / step - 1 : size / step;
689 const size_t fullsize = size + q;
690 size_t i;
691
692 MPFR_ASSERTD (size > 0);
693
694 if (buffer_incr_len (b, fullsize))
695 return 1;
696
697 if (b->size != 0)
698 {
699 char *oldcurr;
700
701 MPFR_ASSERTD (*b->curr == '\0');
702 MPFR_ASSERTN (b->size < ((size_t) -1) - fullsize);
703 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (b->curr + fullsize >= b->start + b->size))
704 buffer_widen (b, fullsize);
705
706 MPFR_DBGRES (oldcurr = b->curr);
707
708 /* first R significant digits */
709 memcpy (b->curr, str, r);
710 b->curr += r;
711 str += r;
712 len -= r;
713
714 /* blocks of thousands. Warning: STR might end in the middle of a block */
715 for (i = 0; i < q; ++i)
716 {
717 *b->curr++ = c;
718 if (MPFR_LIKELY (len > 0))
719 {
720 if (MPFR_LIKELY (len >= step))
721 /* step significant digits */
722 {
723 memcpy (b->curr, str, step);
724 len -= step;
725 }
726 else
727 /* last digits in STR, fill up thousand block with zeros */
728 {
729 memcpy (b->curr, str, len);
730 memset (b->curr + len, '0', step - len);
731 len = 0;
732 }
733 }
734 else
735 /* trailing zeros */
736 memset (b->curr, '0', step);
737
738 b->curr += step;
739 str += step;
740 }
741
742 MPFR_ASSERTD (b->curr - oldcurr == fullsize);
743
744 *b->curr = '\0';
745
746 MPFR_ASSERTD (b->curr < b->start + b->size);
747 }
748
749 return 0;
750 }
751}
752
753/* Helper struct and functions for temporary strings management */
754/* struct for easy string clearing */
755struct string_list
756{
757 char *string;
758 struct string_list *next; /* NULL in last node */
759};
760
761/* initialization */
762static void
763init_string_list (struct string_list *sl)
764{
765 sl->string = NULL;
766 sl->next = NULL;
767}
768
769/* clear all strings in the list */
770static void
771clear_string_list (struct string_list *sl)
772{
773 struct string_list *n;
774
775 while (sl)
776 {
777 if (sl->string)
778 mpfr_free_str (sl->string);
779 n = sl->next;
780 mpfr_free_func (sl, sizeof(struct string_list));
781 sl = n;
782 }
783}
784
785/* add a string in the list */
786static char *
787register_string (struct string_list *sl, char *new_string)
788{
789 /* look for the last node */
790 while (sl->next)
791 sl = sl->next;
792
793 sl->next = (struct string_list*)
794 mpfr_allocate_func (sizeof (struct string_list));
795
796 sl = sl->next;
797 sl->next = NULL;
798 return sl->string = new_string;
799}
800
801/* padding type: where are the padding characters */
802enum pad_t
803 {
804 LEFT, /* spaces in left hand side for right justification */
805 LEADING_ZEROS, /* padding with '0' characters in integral part */
806 RIGHT /* spaces in right hand side for left justification */
807 };
808
809/* number_parts details how much characters are needed in each part of a float
810 print. */
811struct number_parts
812{
813 enum pad_t pad_type; /* Padding type */
814 size_t pad_size; /* Number of padding characters */
815
816 char sign; /* Sign character */
817
818 char *prefix_ptr; /* Pointer to prefix part */
819 size_t prefix_size; /* Number of characters in *prefix_ptr */
820
821 char thousands_sep; /* Thousands separator (only with style 'f') */
822
823 char *ip_ptr; /* Pointer to integral part characters*/
824 size_t ip_size; /* Number of digits in *ip_ptr */
825 int ip_trailing_zeros; /* Number of additional null digits in integral
826 part */
827
828 char point; /* Decimal point character */
829
830 int fp_leading_zeros; /* Number of additional leading zeros in fractional
831 part */
832 char *fp_ptr; /* Pointer to fractional part characters */
833 size_t fp_size; /* Number of digits in *fp_ptr */
834 int fp_trailing_zeros; /* Number of additional trailing zeros in fractional
835 part */
836
837 char *exp_ptr; /* Pointer to exponent part */
838 size_t exp_size; /* Number of characters in *exp_ptr */
839
840 struct string_list *sl; /* List of string buffers in use: we need such a
841 mechanism because fp_ptr may point into the same
842 string as ip_ptr */
843};
844
845/* For a real non zero number x, what is the base exponent f when rounding x
846 with rounding mode r to r(x) = m*b^f, where m is a digit and 1 <= m < b ?
847 Return non zero value if x is rounded up to b^f, return zero otherwise */
848static int
849next_base_power_p (mpfr_srcptr x, int base, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
850{
851 mpfr_prec_t nbits;
852 mp_limb_t pm;
853 mp_limb_t xm;
854
855 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_PURE_FP (x));
856 MPFR_ASSERTD (base == 2 || base == 16);
857
858 /* Warning: the decimal point is AFTER THE FIRST DIGIT in this output
859 representation. */
860 nbits = base == 2 ? 1 : 4;
861
862 if (rnd == MPFR_RNDZ
863 || (rnd == MPFR_RNDD && MPFR_IS_POS (x))
864 || (rnd == MPFR_RNDU && MPFR_IS_NEG (x))
865 || MPFR_PREC (x) <= nbits)
866 /* no rounding when printing x with 1 digit */
867 return 0;
868
869 xm = MPFR_MANT (x) [MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (x) - 1];
870 pm = MPFR_LIMB_MASK (GMP_NUMB_BITS - nbits);
871 if ((xm & ~pm) ^ ~pm)
872 /* do no round up if some of the nbits first bits are 0s. */
873 return 0;
874
875 if (rnd == MPFR_RNDN)
876 /* mask for rounding bit */
877 pm = (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - nbits - 1));
878
879 /* round up if some remaining bits are 1 */
880 /* warning: the return value must be an int */
881 return xm & pm ? 1 : 0;
882}
883
884/* Record information from mpfr_get_str() so as to avoid multiple
885 calls to this expensive function. */
886struct decimal_info
887{
888 mpfr_exp_t exp;
889 char *str;
890};
891
892/* For a real non zero number x, what is the exponent f so that
893 10^f <= x < 10^(f+1). */
894static mpfr_exp_t
895floor_log10 (mpfr_srcptr x)
896{
897 mpfr_t y;
898 mpfr_exp_t exp;
899
900 /* make sure first that y can represent a mpfr_exp_t exactly
901 and can compare with x */
902 mpfr_prec_t prec = sizeof (mpfr_exp_t) * CHAR_BIT;
903 mpfr_init2 (y, MAX (prec, MPFR_PREC (x)));
904
905 exp = mpfr_ceil_mul (MPFR_GET_EXP (x), 10, 1) - 1;
906 mpfr_set_exp_t (y, exp, MPFR_RNDU);
907 /* The following call to mpfr_ui_pow should be fast: y is an integer
908 (not too large), so that mpfr_pow_z will be used internally. */
909 mpfr_ui_pow (y, 10, y, MPFR_RNDU);
910 if (mpfr_cmpabs (x, y) < 0)
911 exp--;
912
913 mpfr_clear (y);
914 return exp;
915}
916
917#define NDIGITS 8
918
919static char*
920mpfr_get_str_aux (mpfr_exp_t *exp, int base, size_t n, const mpfr_t op,
921 const struct printf_spec spec)
922{
923 size_t ndigits;
924 char *str, *s, nine;
925 int neg;
926
927 if (spec.size != 0)
928 return mpfr_get_str (NULL, exp, base, n, op, spec.rnd_mode);
929
930 /* Special case size = 0, i.e., xxx_snprintf with size = 0: we only want
931 to compute the number of printed characters. Try to deduce it from
932 a small number of significant digits. */
933 nine = (base <= 10) ? '0' + base - 1
934 : (base <= 36) ? 'a' + base - 11
935 : 'a' + base - 37;
936 for (ndigits = NDIGITS; ; ndigits *= 2)
937 {
938 mpfr_rnd_t rnd = MPFR_RNDZ;
939 /* when ndigits > n, we reduce it to the target size n, and then we use
940 the wanted rounding mode, to avoid errors for example when n=1 and
941 x = 9.5 with spec.rnd_mode = RNDU */
942 if (ndigits >= n)
943 {
944 ndigits = n;
945 rnd = spec.rnd_mode;
946 }
947 str = mpfr_get_str (NULL, exp, base, ndigits, op, rnd);
948 if (ndigits == n)
949 break;
950 neg = str[0] == '-';
951 s = str + neg;
952 while (*s == nine)
953 s ++;
954 if (s < str + neg + ndigits) /* we don't have ndigits 'nines' */
955 break;
956 mpfr_free_str (str);
957 MPFR_ASSERTN (ndigits <= ((size_t) -1) / 2);
958 /* to make sure that the product by 2 is representable. */
959 }
960 return str;
961}
962
963/* Determine the different parts of the string representation of the regular
964 number P when SPEC.SPEC is 'a', 'A', or 'b'.
965
966 return -1 if some field > INT_MAX */
967static int
968regular_ab (struct number_parts *np, mpfr_srcptr p,
969 const struct printf_spec spec)
970{
971 int uppercase;
972 int base;
973 char *str;
974 mpfr_exp_t exp;
975
976 uppercase = spec.spec == 'A';
977
978 /* sign */
979 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
980 np->sign = '-';
981 else if (spec.showsign || spec.space)
982 np->sign = spec.showsign ? '+' : ' ';
983
984 if (spec.spec == 'a' || spec.spec == 'A')
985 /* prefix part */
986 {
987 np->prefix_size = 2;
988 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->prefix_size);
989 str[0] = '0';
990 str[1] = uppercase ? 'X' : 'x';
991 str[2] = '\0';
992 np->prefix_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
993 }
994
995 /* integral part */
996 np->ip_size = 1;
997 base = (spec.spec == 'b') ? 2 : 16;
998
999 if (spec.prec != 0)
1000 {
1001 size_t nsd;
1002
1003 /* Number of significant digits:
1004 - if no given precision, let mpfr_get_str determine it;
1005 - if a non-zero precision is specified, then one digit before decimal
1006 point plus SPEC.PREC after it (which will give nsd > 1 below). */
1007 MPFR_ASSERTD (np->ip_size == 1); /* thus no integer overflow below */
1008 nsd = spec.prec < 0 ? 0 : (size_t) spec.prec + np->ip_size;
1009 MPFR_ASSERTD (nsd != 1);
1010 str = mpfr_get_str_aux (&exp, base, nsd, p, spec);
1011 register_string (np->sl, str);
1012 np->ip_ptr = MPFR_IS_NEG (p) ? ++str : str; /* skip sign if any */
1013
1014 if (base == 16)
1015 /* EXP is the exponent for radix sixteen with decimal point BEFORE the
1016 first digit, we want the exponent for radix two and the decimal
1017 point AFTER the first digit. */
1018 {
1019 /* An integer overflow is normally not possible since MPFR_EXP_MIN
1020 is twice as large as MPFR_EMIN_MIN. */
1021 MPFR_ASSERTN (exp > (MPFR_EXP_MIN + 3) / 4);
1022 exp = (exp - 1) * 4;
1023 }
1024 else
1025 /* EXP is the exponent for decimal point BEFORE the first digit, we
1026 want the exponent for decimal point AFTER the first digit. */
1027 {
1028 /* An integer overflow is normally not possible since MPFR_EXP_MIN
1029 is twice as large as MPFR_EMIN_MIN. */
1030 MPFR_ASSERTN (exp > MPFR_EXP_MIN);
1031 --exp;
1032 }
1033 }
1034 else if (next_base_power_p (p, base, spec.rnd_mode))
1035 {
1036 str = (char *)mpfr_allocate_func (2);
1037 str[0] = '1';
1038 str[1] = '\0';
1039 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1040
1041 exp = MPFR_GET_EXP (p);
1042 }
1043 else if (base == 2)
1044 {
1045 str = (char *)mpfr_allocate_func (2);
1046 str[0] = '1';
1047 str[1] = '\0';
1048 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1049
1050 exp = MPFR_GET_EXP (p) - 1;
1051 }
1052 else
1053 {
1054 int digit;
1055 mp_limb_t msl = MPFR_MANT (p)[MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (p) - 1];
1056 int rnd_bit = GMP_NUMB_BITS - 5;
1057
1058 /* pick up the 4 first bits */
1059 digit = msl >> (rnd_bit+1);
1060 if (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDA
1061 || (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDU && MPFR_IS_POS (p))
1062 || (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD && MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1063 || (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN
1064 && (msl & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << rnd_bit))))
1065 digit++;
1066 MPFR_ASSERTD (0 <= digit && digit <= 15);
1067
1068 str = (char *)mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->ip_size);
1069 str[0] = num_to_text [digit];
1070 str[1] = '\0';
1071 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1072
1073 exp = MPFR_GET_EXP (p) - 4;
1074 }
1075
1076 if (uppercase)
1077 /* All digits in upper case */
1078 {
1079 char *s1 = str;
1080 while (*s1)
1081 {
1082 switch (*s1)
1083 {
1084 case 'a':
1085 *s1 = 'A';
1086 break;
1087 case 'b':
1088 *s1 = 'B';
1089 break;
1090 case 'c':
1091 *s1 = 'C';
1092 break;
1093 case 'd':
1094 *s1 = 'D';
1095 break;
1096 case 'e':
1097 *s1 = 'E';
1098 break;
1099 case 'f':
1100 *s1 = 'F';
1101 break;
1102 }
1103 s1++;
1104 }
1105 }
1106
1107 if (spec.spec == 'b' || spec.prec != 0)
1108 /* compute the number of digits in fractional part */
1109 {
1110 char *ptr;
1111 size_t str_len;
1112
1113 /* the sign has been skipped, skip also the first digit */
1114 ++str;
1115 str_len = strlen (str);
1116 ptr = str + str_len - 1; /* points to the end of str */
1117
1118 if (spec.prec < 0)
1119 /* remove trailing zeros, if any */
1120 {
1121 while (*ptr == '0' && str_len != 0)
1122 {
1123 --ptr;
1124 --str_len;
1125 }
1126 }
1127
1128 if (str_len > INT_MAX)
1129 /* too many digits in fractional part */
1130 return -1;
1131
1132 if (str_len != 0)
1133 /* there are some non-zero digits in fractional part */
1134 {
1135 np->fp_ptr = str;
1136 np->fp_size = str_len;
1137 MPFR_ASSERTD (str_len > 0 && str_len <= INT_MAX);
1138 if ((int) str_len < spec.prec)
1139 np->fp_trailing_zeros = spec.prec - str_len;
1140 }
1141 }
1142
1143 /* decimal point */
1144 if (np->fp_size != 0 || spec.alt)
1145 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1146
1147 /* the exponent part contains the character 'p', or 'P' plus the sign
1148 character plus at least one digit and only as many more digits as
1149 necessary to represent the exponent.
1150 We assume that |EXP| < 10^INT_MAX. */
1151 np->exp_size = 3;
1152 {
1153 mpfr_uexp_t x;
1154
1155 x = SAFE_ABS (mpfr_uexp_t, exp);
1156 while (x > 9)
1157 {
1158 np->exp_size++;
1159 x /= 10;
1160 }
1161 }
1162 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->exp_size);
1163 np->exp_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1164 {
1165 char exp_fmt[8]; /* contains at most 7 characters like in "p%+.1i",
1166 or "P%+.2li" */
1167
1168 exp_fmt[0] = uppercase ? 'P' : 'p';
1169 exp_fmt[1] = '\0';
1170 strcat (exp_fmt, "%+.1" MPFR_EXP_FSPEC "d");
1171
1172 if (sprintf (str, exp_fmt, (mpfr_eexp_t) exp) < 0)
1173 return -1;
1174 }
1175
1176 return 0;
1177}
1178
1179/* Determine the different parts of the string representation of the regular
1180 number P when spec.spec is 'e', 'E', 'g', or 'G'.
1181 dec_info contains the previously computed exponent and string or is NULL.
1182
1183 return -1 if some field > INT_MAX */
1184static int
1185regular_eg (struct number_parts *np, mpfr_srcptr p,
1186 const struct printf_spec spec, struct decimal_info *dec_info)
1187{
1188 char *str;
1189 mpfr_exp_t exp;
1190
1191 const int uppercase = spec.spec == 'E' || spec.spec == 'G';
1192 const int spec_g = spec.spec == 'g' || spec.spec == 'G';
1193 const int keep_trailing_zeros = (spec_g && spec.alt)
1194 || (!spec_g && (spec.prec > 0));
1195
1196 /* sign */
1197 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1198 np->sign = '-';
1199 else if (spec.showsign || spec.space)
1200 np->sign = spec.showsign ? '+' : ' ';
1201
1202 /* integral part */
1203 np->ip_size = 1;
1204 if (dec_info == NULL)
1205 {
1206 size_t nsd;
1207
1208 /* Number of significant digits:
1209 - if no given precision, then let mpfr_get_str determine it,
1210 - if a precision is specified, then one digit before decimal point
1211 plus SPEC.PREC after it.
1212 We use the fact here that mpfr_get_str allows us to ask for only one
1213 significant digit when the base is not a power of 2. */
1214 MPFR_ASSERTD (np->ip_size == 1); /* thus no integer overflow below */
1215 nsd = spec.prec < 0 ? 0 : (size_t) spec.prec + np->ip_size;
1216 str = mpfr_get_str_aux (&exp, 10, nsd, p, spec);
1217 register_string (np->sl, str);
1218 }
1219 else
1220 {
1221 exp = dec_info->exp;
1222 str = dec_info->str;
1223 }
1224 np->ip_ptr = MPFR_IS_NEG (p) ? ++str : str; /* skip sign if any */
1225
1226 if (spec.prec != 0)
1227 /* compute the number of digits in fractional part */
1228 {
1229 char *ptr;
1230 size_t str_len;
1231
1232 /* the sign has been skipped, skip also the first digit */
1233 ++str;
1234 str_len = strlen (str);
1235 ptr = str + str_len - 1; /* points to the end of str */
1236
1237 if (!keep_trailing_zeros)
1238 /* remove trailing zeros, if any */
1239 {
1240 while (*ptr == '0' && str_len != 0)
1241 {
1242 --ptr;
1243 --str_len;
1244 }
1245 }
1246
1247 if (str_len > INT_MAX)
1248 /* too many digits in fractional part */
1249 return -1;
1250
1251 if (str_len != 0)
1252 /* there are some non-zero digits in fractional part */
1253 {
1254 np->fp_ptr = str;
1255 np->fp_size = str_len;
1256 MPFR_ASSERTD (str_len > 0 && str_len <= INT_MAX);
1257 if ((!spec_g || spec.alt) && spec.prec > 0
1258 && (int) str_len < spec.prec)
1259 /* add missing trailing zeros */
1260 np->fp_trailing_zeros = spec.prec - str_len;
1261 }
1262 }
1263
1264 /* decimal point */
1265 if (np->fp_size != 0 || spec.alt)
1266 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1267
1268 /* EXP is the exponent for decimal point BEFORE the first digit, we want
1269 the exponent for decimal point AFTER the first digit.
1270 Here, no possible overflow because exp < MPFR_EXP (p) / 3 */
1271 exp--;
1272
1273 /* the exponent part contains the character 'e', or 'E' plus the sign
1274 character plus at least two digits and only as many more digits as
1275 necessary to represent the exponent.
1276 We assume that |EXP| < 10^INT_MAX. */
1277 np->exp_size = 3;
1278 {
1279 mpfr_uexp_t x;
1280
1281 x = SAFE_ABS (mpfr_uexp_t, exp);
1282 while (x > 9)
1283 {
1284 np->exp_size++;
1285 x /= 10;
1286 }
1287 }
1288 if (np->exp_size < 4)
1289 np->exp_size = 4;
1290
1291 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->exp_size);
1292 np->exp_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1293
1294 {
1295 char exp_fmt[8]; /* e.g. "e%+.2i", or "E%+.2li" */
1296
1297 exp_fmt[0] = uppercase ? 'E' : 'e';
1298 exp_fmt[1] = '\0';
1299 strcat (exp_fmt, "%+.2" MPFR_EXP_FSPEC "d");
1300
1301 if (sprintf (str, exp_fmt, (mpfr_eexp_t) exp) < 0)
1302 return -1;
1303 }
1304
1305 return 0;
1306}
1307
1308/* Determine the different parts of the string representation of the regular
1309 number P when spec.spec is 'f', 'F', 'g', or 'G'.
1310 DEC_INFO contains the previously computed exponent and string or is NULL.
1311
1312 return -1 if some field of number_parts is greater than INT_MAX */
1313static int
1314regular_fg (struct number_parts *np, mpfr_srcptr p,
1315 const struct printf_spec spec, struct decimal_info *dec_info)
1316{
1317 mpfr_exp_t exp;
1318 char * str;
1319 const int spec_g = (spec.spec == 'g' || spec.spec == 'G');
1320 const int keep_trailing_zeros = !spec_g || spec.alt;
1321
1322 /* WARNING: an empty precision field is forbidden (it means precision = 6
1323 and it should have been changed to 6 before the function call) */
1324 MPFR_ASSERTD (spec.prec >= 0);
1325
1326 /* sign */
1327 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1328 np->sign = '-';
1329 else if (spec.showsign || spec.space)
1330 np->sign = spec.showsign ? '+' : ' ';
1331
1332 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (p) <= 0)
1333 /* 0 < |p| < 1 */
1334 {
1335 /* Most of the time, integral part is 0 */
1336 np->ip_size = 1;
1337 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->ip_size);
1338 str[0] = '0';
1339 str[1] = '\0';
1340 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1341
1342 if (spec.prec == 0)
1343 /* only two possibilities: either 1 or 0. */
1344 {
1345 mpfr_t y;
1346 /* y = abs(p) */
1347 MPFR_ALIAS (y, p, 1, MPFR_EXP (p));
1348
1349 if (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDA
1350 || (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD && MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1351 || (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDU && MPFR_IS_POS (p))
1352 || (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && mpfr_cmp_d (y, 0.5) > 0))
1353 /* rounded up to 1: one digit '1' in integral part.
1354 note that 0.5 is rounded to 0 with RNDN (round ties to even) */
1355 np->ip_ptr[0] = '1';
1356 }
1357 else
1358 {
1359 /* exp = position of the most significant decimal digit. */
1360 exp = floor_log10 (p);
1361 MPFR_ASSERTD (exp < 0);
1362
1363 if (exp < -spec.prec)
1364 /* only the last digit may be non zero */
1365 {
1366 int round_away;
1367 switch (spec.rnd_mode)
1368 {
1369 case MPFR_RNDA:
1370 case MPFR_RNDF: /* round_away = 1 needed for spec_g */
1371 round_away = 1;
1372 break;
1373 case MPFR_RNDZ:
1374 round_away = 0;
1375 break;
1376 case MPFR_RNDD:
1377 round_away = MPFR_IS_NEG (p);
1378 break;
1379 case MPFR_RNDU:
1380 round_away = MPFR_IS_POS (p);
1381 break;
1382 default:
1383 {
1384 /* compare |p| to y = 0.5*10^(-spec.prec) */
1385 mpfr_t y;
1386 mpfr_exp_t e = MAX (MPFR_PREC (p), 56);
1387 int cmp;
1388
1389 MPFR_ASSERTN (spec.rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN);
1390 mpfr_init2 (y, e + 8);
1391
1392 do
1393 {
1394 /* find a lower approximation of
1395 0.5*10^(-spec.prec) different from |p| */
1396 e += 8;
1397 mpfr_set_prec (y, e);
1398 mpfr_set_si (y, -spec.prec, MPFR_RNDN);
1399 mpfr_exp10 (y, y, MPFR_RNDD);
1400 mpfr_div_2ui (y, y, 1, MPFR_RNDN);
1401 cmp = mpfr_cmpabs (y, p);
1402 }
1403 while (cmp == 0);
1404
1405 round_away = cmp < 0;
1406 mpfr_clear (y);
1407 }
1408 break;
1409 }
1410
1411 if (round_away)
1412 /* round away from zero: the last output digit is '1' */
1413 {
1414 np->fp_leading_zeros = spec.prec - 1;
1415
1416 np->fp_size = 1;
1417 str =
1418 (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->fp_size);
1419 str[0] = '1';
1420 str[1] = '\0';
1421 np->fp_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1422 }
1423 else
1424 /* only zeros in fractional part */
1425 {
1426 MPFR_ASSERTD (!spec_g);
1427 np->fp_leading_zeros = spec.prec;
1428 }
1429 }
1430 else /* exp >= -spec.prec */
1431 /* the most significant digits are the last
1432 spec.prec + exp + 1 digits in fractional part */
1433 {
1434 char *ptr;
1435 size_t str_len;
1436
1437 MPFR_ASSERTD (exp >= -spec.prec);
1438 if (dec_info == NULL)
1439 {
1440 size_t nsd;
1441
1442 /* Consequences of earlier assertions (in r11307).
1443 They guarantee that the integers are representable
1444 (i.e., no integer overflow), assuming size_t >= int
1445 as usual. */
1446 MPFR_ASSERTD (exp <= -1);
1447 MPFR_ASSERTD (spec.prec + (exp + 1) >= 0);
1448 nsd = spec.prec + (exp + 1);
1449 /* WARNING: nsd may equal 1, but here we use the
1450 fact that mpfr_get_str can return one digit with
1451 base ten (undocumented feature, see comments in
1452 get_str.c) */
1453
1454 str = mpfr_get_str_aux (&exp, 10, nsd, p, spec);
1455 register_string (np->sl, str);
1456 }
1457 else
1458 {
1459 exp = dec_info->exp;
1460 str = dec_info->str;
1461 }
1462 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1463 /* skip sign */
1464 ++str;
1465 if (exp == 1)
1466 /* round up to 1 */
1467 {
1468 MPFR_ASSERTD (str[0] == '1');
1469 np->ip_ptr[0] = '1';
1470 if (!spec_g || spec.alt)
1471 np->fp_leading_zeros = spec.prec;
1472 }
1473 else
1474 {
1475 np->fp_ptr = str;
1476 np->fp_leading_zeros = -exp;
1477 MPFR_ASSERTD (exp <= 0);
1478
1479 str_len = strlen (str); /* the sign has been skipped */
1480 ptr = str + str_len - 1; /* points to the end of str */
1481
1482 if (!keep_trailing_zeros)
1483 /* remove trailing zeros, if any */
1484 {
1485 while (*ptr == '0' && str_len != 0)
1486 {
1487 --ptr;
1488 --str_len;
1489 }
1490 }
1491
1492 if (str_len > INT_MAX)
1493 /* too many digits in fractional part */
1494 return -1;
1495
1496 MPFR_ASSERTD (str_len > 0);
1497 np->fp_size = str_len;
1498
1499 if ((!spec_g || spec.alt)
1500 && spec.prec > 0
1501 && (np->fp_leading_zeros + np->fp_size < spec.prec))
1502 /* add missing trailing zeros */
1503 np->fp_trailing_zeros = spec.prec - np->fp_leading_zeros
1504 - np->fp_size;
1505 }
1506 }
1507 }
1508
1509 if (spec.alt || np->fp_leading_zeros != 0 || np->fp_size != 0
1510 || np->fp_trailing_zeros != 0)
1511 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1512 }
1513 else
1514 /* 1 <= |p| */
1515 {
1516 size_t str_len;
1517
1518 /* Determine the position of the most significant decimal digit. */
1519 exp = floor_log10 (p);
1520 MPFR_ASSERTD (exp >= 0);
1521 if (exp > INT_MAX)
1522 /* P is too large to print all its integral part digits */
1523 return -1;
1524
1525 if (dec_info == NULL)
1526 { /* this case occurs with mpfr_printf ("%.0RUf", x) with x=9.5 */
1527 str = mpfr_get_str_aux (&exp, 10, spec.prec+exp+1, p, spec);
1528 register_string (np->sl, str);
1529 }
1530 else
1531 {
1532 exp = dec_info->exp;
1533 str = dec_info->str;
1534 }
1535 np->ip_ptr = MPFR_IS_NEG (p) ? ++str : str; /* skip sign */
1536 str_len = strlen (str);
1537
1538 /* integral part */
1539 if (exp > str_len)
1540 /* mpfr_get_str gives no trailing zero when p is rounded up to the next
1541 power of 10 (p integer, so no fractional part) */
1542 {
1543 np->ip_trailing_zeros = exp - str_len;
1544 np->ip_size = str_len;
1545 }
1546 else
1547 np->ip_size = exp;
1548
1549 if (spec.group)
1550 /* thousands separator in integral part */
1551 np->thousands_sep = MPFR_THOUSANDS_SEPARATOR;
1552
1553 /* fractional part */
1554 str += np->ip_size;
1555 str_len -= np->ip_size;
1556 if (!keep_trailing_zeros)
1557 /* remove trailing zeros, if any */
1558 {
1559 char *ptr = str + str_len - 1; /* pointer to the last digit of
1560 str */
1561 while (*ptr == '0' && str_len != 0)
1562 {
1563 --ptr;
1564 --str_len;
1565 }
1566 }
1567
1568 if (str_len > 0)
1569 /* some nonzero digits in fractional part */
1570 {
1571 if (str_len > INT_MAX)
1572 /* too many digits in fractional part */
1573 return -1;
1574
1575 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1576 np->fp_ptr = str;
1577 np->fp_size = str_len;
1578 }
1579
1580 if (keep_trailing_zeros && str_len < spec.prec)
1581 /* add missing trailing zeros */
1582 {
1583 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1584 np->fp_trailing_zeros = spec.prec - np->fp_size;
1585 }
1586
1587 if (spec.alt)
1588 /* add decimal point even if no digits follow it */
1589 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1590 }
1591
1592 return 0;
1593}
1594
1595/* partition_number determines the different parts of the string
1596 representation of the number p according to the given specification.
1597 partition_number initializes the given structure np, so all previous
1598 information in that variable is lost.
1599 return the total number of characters to be written.
1600 return -1 if an error occurred, in that case np's fields are in an undefined
1601 state but all string buffers have been freed. */
1602static mpfr_intmax_t
1603partition_number (struct number_parts *np, mpfr_srcptr p,
1604 struct printf_spec spec)
1605{
1606 char *str;
1607 unsigned int total; /* can hold the sum of two non-negative int's + 1 */
1608 int uppercase;
1609
1610 /* WARNING: left justification means right space padding */
1611 np->pad_type = spec.left ? RIGHT : spec.pad == '0' ? LEADING_ZEROS : LEFT;
1612 np->pad_size = 0;
1613 np->sign = '\0';
1614 np->prefix_ptr =NULL;
1615 np->prefix_size = 0;
1616 np->thousands_sep = '\0';
1617 np->ip_ptr = NULL;
1618 np->ip_size = 0;
1619 np->ip_trailing_zeros = 0;
1620 np->point = '\0';
1621 np->fp_leading_zeros = 0;
1622 np->fp_ptr = NULL;
1623 np->fp_size = 0;
1624 np->fp_trailing_zeros = 0;
1625 np->exp_ptr = NULL;
1626 np->exp_size = 0;
1627 np->sl = (struct string_list *)
1628 mpfr_allocate_func (sizeof (struct string_list));
1629 init_string_list (np->sl);
1630
1631 uppercase = spec.spec == 'A' || spec.spec == 'E' || spec.spec == 'F'
1632 || spec.spec == 'G';
1633
1634 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (p)))
1635 {
1636 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (p))
1637 {
1638 if (np->pad_type == LEADING_ZEROS)
1639 /* don't want "0000nan", change to right justification padding
1640 with left spaces instead */
1641 np->pad_type = LEFT;
1642
1643 np->ip_size = MPFR_NAN_STRING_LENGTH;
1644 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->ip_size);
1645 strcpy (str, uppercase ? MPFR_NAN_STRING_UC : MPFR_NAN_STRING_LC);
1646 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1647 }
1648 else if (MPFR_IS_INF (p))
1649 {
1650 if (np->pad_type == LEADING_ZEROS)
1651 /* don't want "0000inf", change to right justification padding
1652 with left spaces instead */
1653 np->pad_type = LEFT;
1654
1655 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1656 np->sign = '-';
1657
1658 np->ip_size = MPFR_INF_STRING_LENGTH;
1659 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->ip_size);
1660 strcpy (str, uppercase ? MPFR_INF_STRING_UC : MPFR_INF_STRING_LC);
1661 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1662 }
1663 else
1664 {
1665 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_ZERO (p));
1666 /* note: for 'g' spec, zero is always displayed with 'f'-style with
1667 precision spec.prec - 1 and the trailing zeros are removed unless
1668 the flag '#' is used. */
1669 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1670 /* signed zero */
1671 np->sign = '-';
1672 else if (spec.showsign || spec.space)
1673 np->sign = spec.showsign ? '+' : ' ';
1674
1675 if (spec.spec == 'a' || spec.spec == 'A')
1676 /* prefix part */
1677 {
1678 np->prefix_size = 2;
1679 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->prefix_size);
1680 str[0] = '0';
1681 str[1] = uppercase ? 'X' : 'x';
1682 str[2] = '\0';
1683 np->prefix_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1684 }
1685
1686 /* integral part */
1687 np->ip_size = 1;
1688 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->ip_size);
1689 str[0] = '0';
1690 str[1] = '\0';
1691 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1692
1693 if (spec.prec > 0
1694 && ((spec.spec != 'g' && spec.spec != 'G') || spec.alt))
1695 /* fractional part */
1696 {
1697 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1698 np->fp_trailing_zeros = (spec.spec == 'g' || spec.spec == 'G') ?
1699 spec.prec - 1 : spec.prec;
1700 }
1701 else if (spec.alt)
1702 np->point = MPFR_DECIMAL_POINT;
1703
1704 if (spec.spec == 'a' || spec.spec == 'A' || spec.spec == 'b'
1705 || spec.spec == 'e' || spec.spec == 'E')
1706 /* exponent part */
1707 {
1708 np->exp_size = (spec.spec == 'e' || spec.spec == 'E') ? 4 : 3;
1709 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->exp_size);
1710 if (spec.spec == 'e' || spec.spec == 'E')
1711 strcpy (str, uppercase ? "E+00" : "e+00");
1712 else
1713 strcpy (str, uppercase ? "P+0" : "p+0");
1714 np->exp_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1715 }
1716 }
1717 }
1718 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_UBF (p)))
1719 {
1720 /* mpfr_get_str does not support UBF, so that UBF numbers are regarded
1721 as special cases here. This is not much a problem since UBF numbers
1722 are internal to MPFR and here, they only for logging. */
1723 if (np->pad_type == LEADING_ZEROS)
1724 /* change to right justification padding with left spaces */
1725 np->pad_type = LEFT;
1726
1727 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (p))
1728 np->sign = '-';
1729
1730 np->ip_size = 3;
1731 str = (char *) mpfr_allocate_func (1 + np->ip_size);
1732 strcpy (str, uppercase ? "UBF" : "ubf");
1733 np->ip_ptr = register_string (np->sl, str);
1734 /* TODO: output more information (e.g. the exponent) if need be. */
1735 }
1736 else
1737 {
1738 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_PURE_FP (p));
1739 if (spec.spec == 'a' || spec.spec == 'A' || spec.spec == 'b')
1740 {
1741 if (regular_ab (np, p, spec) == -1)
1742 goto error;
1743 }
1744 else if (spec.spec == 'f' || spec.spec == 'F')
1745 {
1746 if (spec.prec < 0)
1747 spec.prec = 6;
1748 if (regular_fg (np, p, spec, NULL) == -1)
1749 goto error;
1750 }
1751 else if (spec.spec == 'e' || spec.spec == 'E')
1752 {
1753 if (regular_eg (np, p, spec, NULL) == -1)
1754 goto error;
1755 }
1756 else
1757 /* %g case */
1758 {
1759 /* Use the C99 rules:
1760 if T > X >= -4 then the conversion is with style 'f'/'F' and
1761 precision T-(X+1).
1762 otherwise, the conversion is with style 'e'/'E' and
1763 precision T-1.
1764 where T is the threshold computed below and X is the exponent
1765 that would be displayed with style 'e' and precision T-1. */
1766 int threshold;
1767 mpfr_exp_t x, e, k;
1768 struct decimal_info dec_info;
1769
1770 threshold = (spec.prec < 0) ? 6 : (spec.prec == 0) ? 1 : spec.prec;
1771
1772 /* Here we cannot call mpfr_get_str_aux since we need the full
1773 significand in dec_info.str.
1774 Moreover, threshold may be huge while one can know that the
1775 number of digits that are not trailing zeros remains limited;
1776 such a limit occurs in practical cases, e.g. with numbers
1777 representable in the IEEE 754-2008 basic formats. Since the
1778 trailing zeros are not necessarily output, we do not want to
1779 waste time and memory by making mpfr_get_str generate them.
1780 So, let us try to find a smaller threshold for mpfr_get_str.
1781 |p| < 2^EXP(p) = 10^(EXP(p)*log10(2)). So, the integer part
1782 takes at most ceil(EXP(p)*log10(2)) digits (unless p rounds
1783 to the next power of 10, but in this case any threshold will
1784 be OK). So, for the integer part, we will take:
1785 max(0,floor((EXP(p)+2)/3)).
1786 Let k = PREC(p) - EXP(p), so that the last bit of p has
1787 weight 2^(-k). If k <= 0, then p is an integer, otherwise
1788 the fractional part in base 10 may have up to k digits
1789 (this bound is reached if the last bit is 1).
1790 Note: The bound could be improved, but this is not critical. */
1791 e = MPFR_GET_EXP (p);
1792 k = MPFR_PREC (p) - e;
1793 e = e <= 0 ? k : (e + 2) / 3 + (k <= 0 ? 0 : k);
1794 MPFR_ASSERTD (e >= 1);
1795
1796 dec_info.str = mpfr_get_str (NULL, &dec_info.exp, 10,
1797 e < threshold ? e : threshold,
1798 p, spec.rnd_mode);
1799 register_string (np->sl, dec_info.str);
1800 /* mpfr_get_str corresponds to a significand between 0.1 and 1,
1801 whereas here we want a significand between 1 and 10. */
1802 x = dec_info.exp - 1;
1803
1804 if (threshold > x && x >= -4)
1805 {
1806 /* the conversion is with style 'f' */
1807 spec.prec = threshold - x - 1;
1808
1809 if (regular_fg (np, p, spec, &dec_info) == -1)
1810 goto error;
1811 }
1812 else
1813 {
1814 spec.prec = threshold - 1;
1815
1816 if (regular_eg (np, p, spec, &dec_info) == -1)
1817 goto error;
1818 }
1819 }
1820 }
1821
1822 /* compute the number of characters to be written verifying it is not too
1823 much */
1824
1825#define INCR_TOTAL(v) \
1826 do { \
1827 MPFR_ASSERTD ((v) >= 0); \
1828 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY ((v) > MPFR_INTMAX_MAX)) \
1829 goto error; \
1830 total += (v); \
1831 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (total > MPFR_INTMAX_MAX)) \
1832 goto error; \
1833 } while (0)
1834
1835 total = np->sign ? 1 : 0;
1836 INCR_TOTAL (np->prefix_size);
1837 INCR_TOTAL (np->ip_size);
1838 INCR_TOTAL (np->ip_trailing_zeros);
1839 MPFR_ASSERTD (np->ip_size + np->ip_trailing_zeros >= 1);
1840 if (np->thousands_sep)
1841 /* ' flag, style f and the thousands separator in current locale is not
1842 reduced to the null character */
1843 INCR_TOTAL ((np->ip_size + np->ip_trailing_zeros - 1) / 3);
1844 if (np->point)
1845 ++total;
1846 INCR_TOTAL (np->fp_leading_zeros);
1847 INCR_TOTAL (np->fp_size);
1848 INCR_TOTAL (np->fp_trailing_zeros);
1849 INCR_TOTAL (np->exp_size);
1850
1851 if (spec.width > total)
1852 /* pad with spaces or zeros depending on np->pad_type */
1853 {
1854 np->pad_size = spec.width - total;
1855 total += np->pad_size; /* here total == spec.width,
1856 so 0 < total <= INT_MAX */
1857 MPFR_ASSERTD (total == spec.width);
1858 }
1859
1860 MPFR_ASSERTD (total > 0 && total <= MPFR_INTMAX_MAX);
1861 return total;
1862
1863 error:
1864 clear_string_list (np->sl);
1865 np->prefix_ptr = NULL;
1866 np->ip_ptr = NULL;
1867 np->fp_ptr = NULL;
1868 np->exp_ptr = NULL;
1869 return -1;
1870}
1871
1872/* sprnt_fp prints a mpfr_t according to spec.spec specification.
1873
1874 return the size of the string (not counting the terminating '\0')
1875 return -1 if the built string is too long (i.e. has more than
1876 INT_MAX or MPFR_INTMAX_MAX characters).
1877
1878 If spec.size is 0, we only want the size of the string.
1879*/
1880static int
1881sprnt_fp (struct string_buffer *buf, mpfr_srcptr p,
1882 const struct printf_spec spec)
1883{
1884 mpfr_intmax_t length, start;
1885 struct number_parts np;
1886
1887 length = partition_number (&np, p, spec);
1888 if (length < 0)
1889 {
1890 buf->len = -1;
1891 return -1;
1892 }
1893
1894 if (spec.size == 0)
1895 {
1896 /* This is equivalent to the following code (no need to fill the buffer
1897 and length is known). */
1898 buffer_incr_len (buf, length);
1899 goto clear_and_exit;
1900 }
1901
1902 MPFR_DBGRES (start = buf->len);
1903
1904 /* right justification padding with left spaces */
1905 if (np.pad_type == LEFT && np.pad_size != 0)
1906 buffer_pad (buf, ' ', np.pad_size);
1907
1908 /* sign character (may be '-', '+', or ' ') */
1909 if (np.sign)
1910 buffer_pad (buf, np.sign, 1);
1911
1912 /* prefix part */
1913 if (np.prefix_ptr)
1914 buffer_cat (buf, np.prefix_ptr, np.prefix_size);
1915
1916 /* right justification padding with leading zeros */
1917 if (np.pad_type == LEADING_ZEROS && np.pad_size != 0)
1918 buffer_pad (buf, '0', np.pad_size);
1919
1920 /* integral part (may also be "nan" or "inf") */
1921 MPFR_ASSERTN (np.ip_ptr != NULL); /* never empty */
1922 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (np.thousands_sep))
1923 buffer_sandwich (buf, np.ip_ptr, np.ip_size, np.ip_trailing_zeros,
1924 np.thousands_sep);
1925 else
1926 {
1927 buffer_cat (buf, np.ip_ptr, np.ip_size);
1928
1929 /* trailing zeros in integral part */
1930 if (np.ip_trailing_zeros != 0)
1931 buffer_pad (buf, '0', np.ip_trailing_zeros);
1932 }
1933
1934 /* decimal point */
1935 if (np.point)
1936 buffer_pad (buf, np.point, 1);
1937
1938 /* leading zeros in fractional part */
1939 if (np.fp_leading_zeros != 0)
1940 buffer_pad (buf, '0', np.fp_leading_zeros);
1941
1942 /* significant digits in fractional part */
1943 if (np.fp_ptr)
1944 buffer_cat (buf, np.fp_ptr, np.fp_size);
1945
1946 /* trailing zeros in fractional part */
1947 if (np.fp_trailing_zeros != 0)
1948 buffer_pad (buf, '0', np.fp_trailing_zeros);
1949
1950 /* exponent part */
1951 if (np.exp_ptr)
1952 buffer_cat (buf, np.exp_ptr, np.exp_size);
1953
1954 /* left justification padding with right spaces */
1955 if (np.pad_type == RIGHT && np.pad_size != 0)
1956 buffer_pad (buf, ' ', np.pad_size);
1957
1958 MPFR_ASSERTD (buf->len == -1 || buf->len - start == length);
1959
1960 clear_and_exit:
1961 clear_string_list (np.sl);
1962 return buf->len == -1 ? -1 : length;
1963}
1964
1965/* The following internal function implements both mpfr_vasprintf and
1966 mpfr_vsnprintf:
1967 (a) either ptr <> NULL, and then Buf and size are not used, and it
1968 implements mpfr_vasprintf (ptr, fmt, ap)
1969 (b) or ptr = NULL, and it implements mpfr_vsnprintf (Buf, size, fmt, ap)
1970 It returns the number of characters that would have been written had 'size'
1971 been sufficiently large, not counting the terminating null character, or -1
1972 if this number is too large for the return type 'int' (overflow).
1973*/
1974int
1975mpfr_vasnprintf_aux (char **ptr, char *Buf, size_t size, const char *fmt,
1976 va_list ap)
1977{
1978 struct string_buffer buf;
1979 int nbchar;
1980
1981 /* informations on the conversion specification filled by the parser */
1982 struct printf_spec spec;
1983 /* flag raised when previous part of fmt need to be processed by
1984 gmp_vsnprintf */
1985 int xgmp_fmt_flag;
1986 /* beginning and end of the previous unprocessed part of fmt */
1987 const char *start, *end;
1988 /* pointer to arguments for gmp_vasprintf */
1989 va_list ap2;
1990
1991 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
1992 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
1993
1994 buffer_init (&buf, ptr != NULL || size != 0 ? 4096 : 0);
1995 xgmp_fmt_flag = 0;
1996 va_copy (ap2, ap);
1997 start = fmt;
1998 while (*fmt != '\0')
1999 {
2000 /* Look for the next format specification */
2001 while (*fmt != '\0' && *fmt != '%')
2002 ++fmt;
2003
2004 if (*fmt == '\0')
2005 break;
2006
2007 if (*++fmt == '%')
2008 /* %%: go one step further otherwise the second '%' would be
2009 considered as a new conversion specification introducing
2010 character */
2011 {
2012 ++fmt;
2013 xgmp_fmt_flag = 1;
2014 continue;
2015 }
2016
2017 end = fmt - 1;
2018
2019 /* format string analysis */
2020 specinfo_init (&spec);
2021 fmt = parse_flags (fmt, &spec);
2022
2023 READ_INT (ap, fmt, spec, width, width_analysis);
2024 width_analysis:
2025 if (spec.width < 0)
2026 {
2027 spec.left = 1;
2028 spec.width = -spec.width;
2029 MPFR_ASSERTN (spec.width < INT_MAX);
2030 }
2031 if (*fmt == '.')
2032 {
2033 const char *f = ++fmt;
2034 READ_INT (ap, fmt, spec, prec, prec_analysis);
2035 prec_analysis:
2036 if (f == fmt)
2037 spec.prec = -1;
2038 }
2039 else
2040 spec.prec = -1;
2041
2042 fmt = parse_arg_type (fmt, &spec);
2043 if (spec.arg_type == UNSUPPORTED)
2044 /* the current architecture doesn't support the type corresponding to
2045 the format specifier; according to the ISO C99 standard, the
2046 behavior is undefined. We choose to print the format specifier as a
2047 literal string, what may be printed after this string is
2048 undefined. */
2049 continue;
2050 else if (spec.arg_type == MPFR_ARG)
2051 {
2052 switch (*fmt)
2053 {
2054 case '\0':
2055 break;
2056 case '*':
2057 ++fmt;
2058 spec.rnd_mode = (mpfr_rnd_t) va_arg (ap, int);
2059 break;
2060 case 'D':
2061 ++fmt;
2062 spec.rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDD;
2063 break;
2064 case 'U':
2065 ++fmt;
2066 spec.rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDU;
2067 break;
2068 case 'Y':
2069 ++fmt;
2070 spec.rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDA;
2071 break;
2072 case 'Z':
2073 ++fmt;
2074 spec.rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
2075 break;
2076 case 'N':
2077 ++fmt;
2078 default:
2079 spec.rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDN;
2080 }
2081 }
2082
2083 spec.spec = *fmt;
2084 if (!specinfo_is_valid (spec))
2085 /* the format specifier is invalid; according to the ISO C99 standard,
2086 the behavior is undefined. We choose to print the invalid format
2087 specifier as a literal string, what may be printed after this
2088 string is undefined. */
2089 continue;
2090
2091 if (*fmt != '\0')
2092 fmt++;
2093
2094 /* Format processing */
2095 if (spec.spec == '\0')
2096 /* end of the format string */
2097 break;
2098 else if (spec.spec == 'n')
2099 /* put the number of characters written so far in the location pointed
2100 by the next va_list argument; the types of pointer accepted are the
2101 same as in GMP (except unsupported quad_t) plus pointer to a mpfr_t
2102 so as to be able to accept the same format strings. */
2103 {
2104 void *p;
2105
2106 p = va_arg (ap, void *);
2107 FLUSH (xgmp_fmt_flag, start, end, ap2, &buf);
2108 va_end (ap2);
2109 start = fmt;
2110
2111 switch (spec.arg_type)
2112 {
2113 case CHAR_ARG:
2114 *(char *) p = (char) buf.len;
2115 break;
2116 case SHORT_ARG:
2117 *(short *) p = (short) buf.len;
2118 break;
2119 case LONG_ARG:
2120 *(long *) p = (long) buf.len;
2121 break;
2122#ifdef HAVE_LONG_LONG
2123 case LONG_LONG_ARG:
2124 *(long long *) p = (long long) buf.len;
2125 break;
2126#endif
2127#ifdef _MPFR_H_HAVE_INTMAX_T
2128 case INTMAX_ARG:
2129 *(intmax_t *) p = (intmax_t) buf.len;
2130 break;
2131#endif
2132 case SIZE_ARG:
2133 *(size_t *) p = buf.len;
2134 break;
2135 case PTRDIFF_ARG:
2136 *(ptrdiff_t *) p = (ptrdiff_t) buf.len;
2137 break;
2138 case MPF_ARG:
2139 mpf_set_ui ((mpf_ptr) p, (unsigned long) buf.len);
2140 break;
2141 case MPQ_ARG:
2142 mpq_set_ui ((mpq_ptr) p, (unsigned long) buf.len, 1L);
2143 break;
2144 case MP_LIMB_ARG:
2145 *(mp_limb_t *) p = (mp_limb_t) buf.len;
2146 break;
2147 case MP_LIMB_ARRAY_ARG:
2148 {
2149 mp_limb_t *q = (mp_limb_t *) p;
2150 mp_size_t n;
2151 n = va_arg (ap, mp_size_t);
2152 if (n < 0)
2153 n = -n;
2154 else if (n == 0)
2155 break;
2156
2157 /* we assume here that mp_limb_t is wider than int */
2158 *q = (mp_limb_t) buf.len;
2159 while (--n != 0)
2160 {
2161 q++;
2162 *q = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
2163 }
2164 }
2165 break;
2166 case MPZ_ARG:
2167 mpz_set_ui ((mpz_ptr) p, (unsigned long) buf.len);
2168 break;
2169
2170 case MPFR_ARG:
2171 mpfr_set_ui ((mpfr_ptr) p, (unsigned long) buf.len,
2172 spec.rnd_mode);
2173 break;
2174
2175 default:
2176 *(int *) p = (int) buf.len;
2177 }
2178 va_copy (ap2, ap); /* after the switch, due to MP_LIMB_ARRAY_ARG
2179 case */
2180 }
2181 else if (spec.arg_type == MPFR_PREC_ARG)
2182 /* output mpfr_prec_t variable */
2183 {
2184 char *s;
2185 char format[MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_SIZE + 6]; /* see examples below */
2186 size_t length;
2187 mpfr_prec_t prec;
2188
2189 prec = va_arg (ap, mpfr_prec_t);
2190
2191 FLUSH (xgmp_fmt_flag, start, end, ap2, &buf);
2192 va_end (ap2);
2193 va_copy (ap2, ap);
2194 start = fmt;
2195
2196 /* construct format string, like "%*.*hd" "%*.*d" or "%*.*ld" */
2197 format[0] = '%';
2198 format[1] = '*';
2199 format[2] = '.';
2200 format[3] = '*';
2201 format[4] = '\0';
2202 strcat (format, MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_TYPE);
2203 format[4 + MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_SIZE] = spec.spec;
2204 format[5 + MPFR_PREC_FORMAT_SIZE] = '\0';
2205 length = gmp_asprintf (&s, format, spec.width, spec.prec, prec);
2206 MPFR_ASSERTN (length >= 0); /* guaranteed by GMP 6 */
2207 buffer_cat (&buf, s, length);
2208 mpfr_free_str (s);
2209 }
2210 else if (spec.arg_type == MPFR_ARG)
2211 /* output a mpfr_t variable */
2212 {
2213 mpfr_srcptr p;
2214
2215 if (spec.spec != 'a' && spec.spec != 'A'
2216 && spec.spec != 'b'
2217 && spec.spec != 'e' && spec.spec != 'E'
2218 && spec.spec != 'f' && spec.spec != 'F'
2219 && spec.spec != 'g' && spec.spec != 'G')
2220 /* the format specifier is invalid; skip the invalid format
2221 specifier so as to print it as a literal string. What may be
2222 printed after this string is undefined. */
2223 continue;
2224
2225 p = va_arg (ap, mpfr_srcptr);
2226
2227 FLUSH (xgmp_fmt_flag, start, end, ap2, &buf);
2228 va_end (ap2);
2229 va_copy (ap2, ap);
2230 start = fmt;
2231
2232 if (ptr == NULL)
2233 spec.size = size;
2234 sprnt_fp (&buf, p, spec);
2235 }
2236 else
2237 /* gmp_printf specification, step forward in the va_list */
2238 {
2239 CONSUME_VA_ARG (spec, ap);
2240 xgmp_fmt_flag = 1;
2241 }
2242 }
2243
2244 if (start != fmt)
2245 FLUSH (xgmp_fmt_flag, start, fmt, ap2, &buf);
2246
2247 va_end (ap2);
2248
2249 if (buf.len > INT_MAX) /* overflow */
2250 buf.len = -1;
2251
2252 if (buf.len != -1)
2253 {
2254 nbchar = buf.len;
2255 MPFR_ASSERTD (nbchar >= 0);
2256
2257 if (ptr != NULL) /* implement mpfr_vasprintf */
2258 {
2259 MPFR_ASSERTD (nbchar == strlen (buf.start));
2260 *ptr = (char *)
2261 mpfr_reallocate_func (buf.start, buf.size, nbchar + 1);
2262 }
2263 else if (size > 0) /* implement mpfr_vsnprintf */
2264 {
2265 if (nbchar < size)
2266 {
2267 strncpy (Buf, buf.start, nbchar);
2268 Buf[nbchar] = '\0';
2269 }
2270 else
2271 {
2272 strncpy (Buf, buf.start, size - 1);
2273 Buf[size-1] = '\0';
2274 }
2275 mpfr_free_func (buf.start, buf.size);
2276 }
2277
2278 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
2279 return nbchar; /* return the number of characters that would have
2280 been written had 'size' been sufficiently large,
2281 not counting the terminating null character */
2282 }
2283
2284 error:
2285 if (buf.len == -1) /* overflow */
2286 {
2287 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("Overflow\n", 0));
2288 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, MPFR_FLAGS_ERANGE);
2289#ifdef EOVERFLOW
2290 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("Setting errno to EOVERFLOW\n", 0));
2291 errno = EOVERFLOW;
2292#endif
2293 }
2294
2295 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
2296 *ptr = NULL;
2297 mpfr_free_func (buf.start, buf.size);
2298
2299 return -1;
2300}
2301
2302#else /* HAVE_STDARG */
2303
2304/* Avoid an empty translation unit (see ISO C99, 6.9) */
2305typedef int foo;
2306
2307#endif /* HAVE_STDARG */
